      curl --request DELETE \
    --url 'https://example.booqable.com/api/boomerang/tax_regions/df7663bd-6f0f-44ad-947d-ca91d8928d76' \
    --header 'content-type: application/json' \
    --data '{}'

    A 200 status response looks like this:

      {
  "meta": {}
}

    HTTP Request

    DELETE /api/boomerang/tax_regions/{id}

    Request params

    This request accepts the following paramaters:

    Name Description
    include String
    List of comma seperated relationships ?include=tax_rates
    fields[] Array
    List of comma seperated fields to include ?fields[tax_regions]=id,created_at,updated_at

    Includes

    This request does not accept any includes

    Tax values

    Tax values are always generated automatically by price calculations for orders and carts. They hold information about the amount taxed for a specific rate.

    Endpoints

    GET api/boomerang/tax_values

    GET /api/boomerang/tax_values/{id}

    Fields

    Every tax value has the following fields:

    Name Description
    id Uuid readonly
    Primary key
    created_at Datetime readonly
    When the resource was created
    updated_at Datetime readonly
    When the resource was last updated
    name String readonly
    Name of the tax rate
    percentage Float readonly
    The percentage taxed
    value_in_cents Integer readonly
    Amount of tax in cents
    tax_rate_id Uuid readonly
    The associated Tax rate
    owner_id Uuid readonly
    ID of its owner
    owner_type String readonly
    The resource type of the owner. One of orders, documents, carts, lines

    Relationships

    Tax values have the following relationships:

    Name Description
    tax_rate Tax rates readonly
    Associated Tax rate
    owner Order
    Associated Owner

    Listing tax values

    How to fetch a list of tax values:

      curl --request GET \
    --url 'https://example.booqable.com/api/boomerang/tax_values' \
    --header 'content-type: application/json' \

    A 200 status response looks like this:

      {
  "data": [
    {
      "id": "8a53e25e-f69c-4374-acbc-3bfc02e896bf",
      "type": "tax_values",
      "attributes": {
        "created_at": "2021-11-18T14:43:51+00:00",
        "updated_at": "2021-11-18T14:43:51+00:00",
        "name": "VAT 19%",
        "percentage": 19.0,
        "value_in_cents": 13800,
        "tax_rate_id": "50ded854-de13-4212-8873-03f7c1f69132",
        "owner_id": "71e2dfd5-f24d-4f77-9993-3aa5e04ca812",
        "owner_type": "orders"
      },
      "relationships": {
        "tax_rate": {
          "links": {
            "related": "api/boomerang/tax_rates/50ded854-de13-4212-8873-03f7c1f69132"
          }
        },
        "owner": {
          "links": {
            "related": "api/boomerang/orders/71e2dfd5-f24d-4f77-9993-3aa5e04ca812"
          }
        }
      }
    }
  ],
  "links": {
    "self": "api/boomerang/tax_values?page%5Bnumber%5D=1&page%5Bsize%5D=25",
    "first": "api/boomerang/tax_values?page%5Bnumber%5D=1&page%5Bsize%5D=25",
    "last": "api/boomerang/tax_values?page%5Bnumber%5D=1&page%5Bsize%5D=25"
  },
  "meta": {}
}

    HTTP Request

    GET api/boomerang/tax_values

    Request params

    This request accepts the following paramaters:

    Name Description
    include String
    List of comma seperated relationships ?include=tax_rate,owner
    fields[] Array
    List of comma seperated fields to include ?fields[tax_values]=id,created_at,updated_at
    filter Hash
    The filters to apply ?filter[created_at][gte]=2021-11-18T14:41:21Z
    sort String
    How to sort the data ?sort=-created_at
    meta Hash
    Metadata to send along ?meta[total][]=count
    page[number] String
    The page to request
    page[size] String
    The amount of items per page (max 100)

    Filters

    This request can be filtered on:

    Name Description
    id Uuid
    eq, not_eq
    created_at Datetime
    eq, not_eq, gt, gte, lt, lte
    updated_at Datetime
    eq, not_eq, gt, gte, lt, lte
    name String
    eq, not_eq, eql, not_eql, prefix, not_prefix, suffix, not_suffix, match, not_match
    percentage Float
    eq, not_eq, gt, gte, lt, lte
    tax_rate_id Uuid
    eq, not_eq
    owner_id Uuid
    eq, not_eq
    owner_type String
    eq, not_eq

    Meta

    Results can be aggregated on:

    Name Description
    value_in_cents Array
    sum, maximum, minimum, average
    total Array
    count

    Includes

    This request does not accept any includes

    Fetching a tax value

    How to fetch a tax value:

      curl --request GET \
    --url 'https://example.booqable.com/api/boomerang/tax_values/af2a1a07-e781-4e9f-ab95-bed6ac198352?include=owner' \
    --header 'content-type: application/json' \

    A 200 status response looks like this:

      {
  "data": {
    "id": "af2a1a07-e781-4e9f-ab95-bed6ac198352",
    "type": "tax_values",
    "attributes": {
      "created_at": "2021-11-18T14:43:51+00:00",
      "updated_at": "2021-11-18T14:43:51+00:00",
      "name": "VAT 19%",
      "percentage": 19.0,
      "value_in_cents": 13800,
      "tax_rate_id": "2b6658a1-8cf0-4fff-86a1-16c70b3e0fdd",
      "owner_id": "96a8e2ed-3fdc-4fdb-92ec-23578f773a9e",
      "owner_type": "orders"
    },
    "relationships": {
      "tax_rate": {
        "links": {
          "related": "api/boomerang/tax_rates/2b6658a1-8cf0-4fff-86a1-16c70b3e0fdd"
        }
      },
      "owner": {
        "links": {
          "related": "api/boomerang/orders/96a8e2ed-3fdc-4fdb-92ec-23578f773a9e"
        },
        "data": {
          "type": "orders",
          "id": "96a8e2ed-3fdc-4fdb-92ec-23578f773a9e"
        }
      }
    }
  },
  "included": [
    {
      "id": "96a8e2ed-3fdc-4fdb-92ec-23578f773a9e",
      "type": "orders",
      "attributes": {
        "created_at": "2021-11-18T14:43:51+00:00",
        "updated_at": "2021-11-18T14:43:51+00:00",
        "number": null,
        "status": "new",
        "statuses": [
          "new"
        ],
        "status_counts": {},
        "starts_at": "2021-11-16T14:30:00+00:00",
        "stops_at": "2021-11-20T14:30:00+00:00",
        "deposit_type": "percentage",
        "deposit_value": 100,
        "entirely_started": false,
        "entirely_stopped": false,
        "location_shortage": false,
        "shortage": false,
        "payment_status": "paid",
        "tag_list": [],
        "properties": {},
        "price_in_cents": 0,
        "grand_total_in_cents": 0,
        "grand_total_with_tax_in_cents": 0,
        "tax_in_cents": 0,
        "discount_in_cents": 0,
        "coupon_discount_in_cents": 0,
        "total_discount_in_cents": 0,
        "deposit_in_cents": 0,
        "deposit_paid_in_cents": 0,
        "deposit_refunded_in_cents": 0,
        "deposit_held_in_cents": 0,
        "deposit_to_refund_in_cents": 0,
        "to_be_paid_in_cents": 0,
        "paid_in_cents": 0,
        "discount_percentage": 0.0,
        "customer_id": null,
        "tax_region_id": null,
        "coupon_id": null,
        "start_location_id": "98b24dcd-d8d1-402b-b42c-9b2ce7fbbfe2",
        "stop_location_id": "98b24dcd-d8d1-402b-b42c-9b2ce7fbbfe2"
      },
      "relationships": {
        "customer": {
          "links": {
            "related": null
          }
        },
        "tax_region": {
          "links": {
            "related": null
          }
        },
        "coupon": {
          "links": {
            "related": null
          }
        },
        "barcode": {
          "links": {
            "related": "api/boomerang/barcodes?filter[owner_id]=96a8e2ed-3fdc-4fdb-92ec-23578f773a9e&filter[owner_type]=orders"
          }
        },
        "properties": {
          "links": {
            "related": "api/boomerang/properties?filter[owner_id]=96a8e2ed-3fdc-4fdb-92ec-23578f773a9e&filter[owner_type]=orders"
          }
        },
        "start_location": {
          "links": {
            "related": "api/boomerang/locations/98b24dcd-d8d1-402b-b42c-9b2ce7fbbfe2"
          }
        },
        "stop_location": {
          "links": {
            "related": "api/boomerang/locations/98b24dcd-d8d1-402b-b42c-9b2ce7fbbfe2"
          }
        },
        "tax_values": {
          "links": {
            "related": "api/boomerang/tax_values?filter[owner_id]=96a8e2ed-3fdc-4fdb-92ec-23578f773a9e"
          }
        },
        "lines": {
          "links": {
            "related": "api/boomerang/lines?filter[owner_id]=96a8e2ed-3fdc-4fdb-92ec-23578f773a9e&filter[owner_type]=orders"
          }
        },
        "stock_item_plannings": {
          "links": {
            "related": "api/boomerang/stock_item_plannings?filter[order_id]=96a8e2ed-3fdc-4fdb-92ec-23578f773a9e"
          }
        }
      }
    }
  ],
  "meta": {}
}

    HTTP Request

    GET /api/boomerang/tax_values/{id}

    Request params

    This request accepts the following paramaters:

    Name Description
    include String
    List of comma seperated relationships ?include=tax_rate,owner
    fields[] Array
    List of comma seperated fields to include ?fields[tax_values]=id,created_at,updated_at

    Includes

    This request accepts the following includes:

    owner

    Users

    Users can be used to log into the web shop. They are useful for exposing your shop to a limited audience or verifiying that a customers can actually be reached via an email.

    A user always belongs to a Customer. A customer can have multiple users. This is relevant for companies where multiple people are allowed to book orders in the name of that company. Because of this, a user should always be an actual person, not a legal person.

    Depending on the setting in your Booqable account, creating a user can actually mean that you're inviting the user. In that case, the user still needs to confirm their email and set a password before the account is active. (See status)

    Endpoints

    GET /api/boomerang/users

    GET /api/boomerang/users/{id}

    POST /api/boomerang/users

    PUT /api/boomerang/users/{id}

    PUT /api/boomerang/users/{id}

    PUT /api/boomerang/users/{id}

    Fields

    Every user has the following fields:

    Name Description
    id Uuid readonly
    Primary key
    created_at Datetime readonly
    When the resource was created
    updated_at Datetime readonly
    When the resource was last updated
    first_name String
    The first name of the user
    last_name String
    The last name of the user
    name String
    The full name of the user (first_name + last_name)
    email String
    The email of the user
    status String readonly
    One of disabled, active, invited, unconfirmed
    disabled Boolean writeonly
    When a user is disabled they cannot log into their account or create orders
    customer_id Uuid
    The associated Customer

    Relationships

    Users have the following relationships:

    Name Description
    customer Customers
    Associated Customer
    notes Notes readonly
    Associated Notes

    Listing users

    How to fetch a list of users:

      curl --request GET \
    --url 'https://example.booqable.com/api/boomerang/users' \
    --header 'content-type: application/json' \

    A 200 status response looks like this:

      {
  "data": [
    {
      "id": "db8b2797-53b3-40ea-ae9d-496c92883761",
      "type": "users",
      "attributes": {
        "created_at": "2021-11-18T14:43:52+00:00",
        "updated_at": "2021-11-18T14:43:52+00:00",
        "first_name": "Buck",
        "last_name": "Cole",
        "name": "Buck Cole",
        "email": "cole.buck@kiehn.io",
        "status": "active",
        "customer_id": "67420cf4-ecfd-420c-b908-60d23a71023c"
      },
      "relationships": {
        "customer": {
          "links": {
            "related": "api/boomerang/customers/67420cf4-ecfd-420c-b908-60d23a71023c"
          }
        },
        "notes": {
          "links": {
            "related": "api/boomerang/notes?filter[owner_id]=db8b2797-53b3-40ea-ae9d-496c92883761&filter[owner_type]=users"
          }
        }
      }
    }
  ],
  "links": {
    "self": "api/boomerang/users?page%5Bnumber%5D=1&page%5Bsize%5D=25",
    "first": "api/boomerang/users?page%5Bnumber%5D=1&page%5Bsize%5D=25",
    "last": "api/boomerang/users?page%5Bnumber%5D=1&page%5Bsize%5D=25"
  },
  "meta": {}
}

    How to find users belonging to a customer:

      curl --request GET \
    --url 'https://example.booqable.com/api/boomerang/users?filter%5Bcustomer_id%5D=3f9b163c-c920-42a8-a248-a0c2f28ec337&include=customer' \
    --header 'content-type: application/json' \

    A 200 status response looks like this:

      {
  "data": [
    {
      "id": "0ad8a9bf-350e-47c8-b57d-805980125040",
      "type": "users",
      "attributes": {
        "created_at": "2021-11-18T14:43:52+00:00",
        "updated_at": "2021-11-18T14:43:52+00:00",
        "first_name": "Jesse",
        "last_name": "Marvin",
        "name": "Jesse Marvin",
        "email": "jesse_marvin@beer.name",
        "status": "active",
        "customer_id": "3f9b163c-c920-42a8-a248-a0c2f28ec337"
      },
      "relationships": {
        "customer": {
          "links": {
            "related": "api/boomerang/customers/3f9b163c-c920-42a8-a248-a0c2f28ec337"
          }
        },
        "notes": {
          "links": {
            "related": "api/boomerang/notes?filter[owner_id]=0ad8a9bf-350e-47c8-b57d-805980125040&filter[owner_type]=users"
          }
        }
      }
    }
  ],
  "links": {
    "self": "api/boomerang/users?filter%5Bcustomer_id%5D=3f9b163c-c920-42a8-a248-a0c2f28ec337&include=customer&page%5Bnumber%5D=1&page%5Bsize%5D=25",
    "first": "api/boomerang/users?filter%5Bcustomer_id%5D=3f9b163c-c920-42a8-a248-a0c2f28ec337&include=customer&page%5Bnumber%5D=1&page%5Bsize%5D=25",
    "last": "api/boomerang/users?filter%5Bcustomer_id%5D=3f9b163c-c920-42a8-a248-a0c2f28ec337&include=customer&page%5Bnumber%5D=1&page%5Bsize%5D=25"
  },
  "meta": {}
}

    HTTP Request

    GET /api/boomerang/users

    Request params

    This request accepts the following paramaters:

    Name Description
    include String
    List of comma seperated relationships ?include=customer,notes
    fields[] Array
    List of comma seperated fields to include ?fields[users]=id,created_at,updated_at
    filter Hash
    The filters to apply ?filter[created_at][gte]=2021-11-18T14:41:21Z
    sort String
    How to sort the data ?sort=-created_at
    meta Hash
    Metadata to send along ?meta[total][]=count
    page[number] String
    The page to request
    page[size] String
    The amount of items per page (max 100)

    Filters

    This request can be filtered on:

    Name Description
    id Uuid
    eq, not_eq
    created_at Datetime
    eq, not_eq, gt, gte, lt, lte
    updated_at Datetime
    eq, not_eq, gt, gte, lt, lte
    first_name String
    eq, not_eq, eql, not_eql, prefix, not_prefix, suffix, not_suffix, match, not_match
    last_name String
    eq, not_eq, eql, not_eql, prefix, not_prefix, suffix, not_suffix, match, not_match
    name String
    eq, not_eq, eql, not_eql, prefix, not_prefix, suffix, not_suffix, match, not_match
    email String
    eq, not_eq, eql, not_eql, prefix, not_prefix, suffix, not_suffix, match, not_match
    status String
    eq, not_eq, eql, not_eql, prefix, not_prefix, suffix, not_suffix, match, not_match
    customer_id Uuid
    eq, not_eq

    Meta

    Results can be aggregated on:

    Name Description
    total Array
    count

    Includes

    This request does not accept any includes

    Fetching a user

    How to fetch a user:

      curl --request GET \
    --url 'https://example.booqable.com/api/boomerang/users/40412540-60e1-49d6-a5a4-191dc6bd3050' \
    --header 'content-type: application/json' \

    A 200 status response looks like this:

      {
  "data": {
    "id": "40412540-60e1-49d6-a5a4-191dc6bd3050",
    "type": "users",
    "attributes": {
      "created_at": "2021-11-18T14:43:53+00:00",
      "updated_at": "2021-11-18T14:43:53+00:00",
      "first_name": "Federico",
      "last_name": "Tillman",
      "name": "Federico Tillman",
      "email": "tillman.federico@ernser-ebert.io",
      "status": "active",
      "customer_id": "35f3a384-f30a-4370-8a03-0fe5e6e2f51b"
    },
    "relationships": {
      "customer": {
        "links": {
          "related": "api/boomerang/customers/35f3a384-f30a-4370-8a03-0fe5e6e2f51b"
        }
      },
      "notes": {
        "links": {
          "related": "api/boomerang/notes?filter[owner_id]=40412540-60e1-49d6-a5a4-191dc6bd3050&filter[owner_type]=users"
        }
      }
    }
  },
  "meta": {}
}

    HTTP Request

    GET /api/boomerang/users/{id}

    Request params

    This request accepts the following paramaters:

    Name Description
    include String
    List of comma seperated relationships ?include=customer,notes
    fields[] Array
    List of comma seperated fields to include ?fields[users]=id,created_at,updated_at

    Includes

    This request accepts the following includes:

    customer

    disabled_by

    notes

    Inviting a user

    How to invite a user:

      curl --request POST \
    --url 'https://example.booqable.com/api/boomerang/users' \
    --header 'content-type: application/json' \
    --data '{
      "data": {
        "type": "users",
        "attributes": {
          "first_name": "Bob",
          "last_name": "Bobsen",
          "email": "bob@booqable.com",
          "customer_id": "a57404a5-59bc-4aba-818b-e10dd415dbe3"
        }
      }
    }'

    A 201 status response looks like this:

      {
  "data": {
    "id": "0a329666-4855-4489-bde5-7794379fbbf3",
    "type": "users",
    "attributes": {
      "created_at": "2021-11-18T14:43:53+00:00",
      "updated_at": "2021-11-18T14:43:53+00:00",
      "first_name": "Bob",
      "last_name": "Bobsen",
      "name": "Bob Bobsen",
      "email": "bob@booqable.com",
      "status": "invited",
      "customer_id": "a57404a5-59bc-4aba-818b-e10dd415dbe3"
    },
    "relationships": {
      "customer": {
        "meta": {
          "included": false
        }
      },
      "notes": {
        "meta": {
          "included": false
        }
      }
    }
  },
  "links": {
    "self": "api/boomerang/users?data%5Battributes%5D%5Bcustomer_id%5D=a57404a5-59bc-4aba-818b-e10dd415dbe3&data%5Battributes%5D%5Bemail%5D=bob%40booqable.com&data%5Battributes%5D%5Bfirst_name%5D=Bob&data%5Battributes%5D%5Blast_name%5D=Bobsen&data%5Btype%5D=users&page%5Bnumber%5D=1&page%5Bsize%5D=25",
    "first": "api/boomerang/users?data%5Battributes%5D%5Bcustomer_id%5D=a57404a5-59bc-4aba-818b-e10dd415dbe3&data%5Battributes%5D%5Bemail%5D=bob%40booqable.com&data%5Battributes%5D%5Bfirst_name%5D=Bob&data%5Battributes%5D%5Blast_name%5D=Bobsen&data%5Btype%5D=users&page%5Bnumber%5D=1&page%5Bsize%5D=25",
    "last": "api/boomerang/users?data%5Battributes%5D%5Bcustomer_id%5D=a57404a5-59bc-4aba-818b-e10dd415dbe3&data%5Battributes%5D%5Bemail%5D=bob%40booqable.com&data%5Battributes%5D%5Bfirst_name%5D=Bob&data%5Battributes%5D%5Blast_name%5D=Bobsen&data%5Btype%5D=users&page%5Bnumber%5D=1&page%5Bsize%5D=25"
  },
  "meta": {}
}

    HTTP Request

    POST /api/boomerang/users

    Request params

    This request accepts the following paramaters:

    Name Description
    include String
    List of comma seperated relationships ?include=customer,notes
    fields[] Array
    List of comma seperated fields to include ?fields[users]=id,created_at,updated_at

    Request body

    This request accepts the following body:

    Name Description
    data[attributes][first_name] String
    The first name of the user
    data[attributes][last_name] String
    The last name of the user
    data[attributes][name] String
    The full name of the user (first_name + last_name)
    data[attributes][email] String
    The email of the user
    data[attributes][disabled] Boolean
    When a user is disabled they cannot log into their account or create orders
    data[attributes][customer_id] Uuid
    The associated Customer

    Includes

    This request accepts the following includes:

    customer

    disabled_by

    notes

    Updating a user

    How to update a user:

      curl --request PUT \
    --url 'https://example.booqable.com/api/boomerang/users/01728cc7-d6bc-4844-bb32-74e71d0b4fb7' \
    --header 'content-type: application/json' \
    --data '{
      "data": {
        "id": "01728cc7-d6bc-4844-bb32-74e71d0b4fb7",
        "type": "users",
        "attributes": {
          "first_name": "Bobba"
        }
      }
    }'

    A 200 status response looks like this:

      {
  "data": {
    "id": "01728cc7-d6bc-4844-bb32-74e71d0b4fb7",
    "type": "users",
    "attributes": {
      "created_at": "2021-11-18T14:43:53+00:00",
      "updated_at": "2021-11-18T14:43:53+00:00",
      "first_name": "Bobba",
      "last_name": "Stroman",
      "name": "Bobba Stroman",
      "email": "edward_stroman@gutmann.biz",
      "status": "active",
      "customer_id": "c175b7ed-9bd6-4d9e-9d78-10b7445c6ae7"
    },
    "relationships": {
      "customer": {
        "meta": {
          "included": false
        }
      },
      "notes": {
        "meta": {
          "included": false
        }
      }
    }
  },
  "meta": {}
}

    HTTP Request

    PUT /api/boomerang/users/{id}

    Request params

    This request accepts the following paramaters:

    Name Description
    include String
    List of comma seperated relationships ?include=customer,notes
    fields[] Array
    List of comma seperated fields to include ?fields[users]=id,created_at,updated_at

    Request body

    This request accepts the following body:

    Name Description
    data[attributes][first_name] String
    The first name of the user
    data[attributes][last_name] String
    The last name of the user
    data[attributes][name] String
    The full name of the user (first_name + last_name)
    data[attributes][email] String
    The email of the user
    data[attributes][disabled] Boolean
    When a user is disabled they cannot log into their account or create orders
    data[attributes][customer_id] Uuid
    The associated Customer

    Includes

    This request accepts the following includes:

    customer

    disabled_by

    notes

    Enabling a user

    How to enable a user:

      curl --request PUT \
    --url 'https://example.booqable.com/api/boomerang/users/305f7a2a-ab5f-47a7-926d-92dbf0a399bd' \
    --header 'content-type: application/json' \
    --data '{
      "data": {
        "id": "305f7a2a-ab5f-47a7-926d-92dbf0a399bd",
        "type": "users",
        "attributes": {
          "disabled": false
        }
      }
    }'

    A 200 status response looks like this:

      {
  "data": {
    "id": "305f7a2a-ab5f-47a7-926d-92dbf0a399bd",
    "type": "users",
    "attributes": {
      "created_at": "2021-11-18T14:43:54+00:00",
      "updated_at": "2021-11-18T14:43:54+00:00",
      "first_name": "Guy",
      "last_name": "Kulas",
      "name": "Guy Kulas",
      "email": "guy_kulas@herzog.info",
      "status": "active",
      "customer_id": "750e0d56-85bf-4a29-9dd0-b0f897a63e0f"
    },
    "relationships": {
      "customer": {
        "meta": {
          "included": false
        }
      },
      "notes": {
        "meta": {
          "included": false
        }
      }
    }
  },
  "meta": {}
}

    HTTP Request

    PUT /api/boomerang/users/{id}

    Request params

    This request accepts the following paramaters:

    Name Description
    include String
    List of comma seperated relationships ?include=customer,notes
    fields[] Array
    List of comma seperated fields to include ?fields[users]=id,created_at,updated_at

    Request body

    This request accepts the following body:

    Name Description
    data[attributes][first_name] String
    The first name of the user
    data[attributes][last_name] String
    The last name of the user
    data[attributes][name] String
    The full name of the user (first_name + last_name)
    data[attributes][email] String
    The email of the user
    data[attributes][disabled] Boolean
    When a user is disabled they cannot log into their account or create orders
    data[attributes][customer_id] Uuid
    The associated Customer

    Includes

    This request accepts the following includes:

    customer

    disabled_by

    notes

    Disabling a user

    How to disable a user:

      curl --request PUT \
    --url 'https://example.booqable.com/api/boomerang/users/2ebd1985-0c27-4827-a02d-b75badc5fdab' \
    --header 'content-type: application/json' \
    --data '{
      "data": {
        "id": "2ebd1985-0c27-4827-a02d-b75badc5fdab",
        "type": "users",
        "attributes": {
          "disabled": true
        }
      }
    }'

    A 200 status response looks like this:

      {
  "data": {
    "id": "2ebd1985-0c27-4827-a02d-b75badc5fdab",
    "type": "users",
    "attributes": {
      "created_at": "2021-11-18T14:43:54+00:00",
      "updated_at": "2021-11-18T14:43:54+00:00",
      "first_name": "Carol",
      "last_name": "Klocko",
      "name": "Carol Klocko",
      "email": "klocko_carol@gerhold.info",
      "status": "disabled",
      "customer_id": "6a2912fe-2df0-4d72-b794-8b6b38434c26"
    },
    "relationships": {
      "customer": {
        "meta": {
          "included": false
        }
      },
      "notes": {
        "meta": {
          "included": false
        }
      }
    }
  },
  "meta": {}
}

    HTTP Request

    PUT /api/boomerang/users/{id}

    Request params

    This request accepts the following paramaters:

    Name Description
    include String
    List of comma seperated relationships ?include=customer,notes
    fields[] Array
    List of comma seperated fields to include ?fields[users]=id,created_at,updated_at

    Request body

    This request accepts the following body:

    Name Description
    data[attributes][first_name] String
    The first name of the user
    data[attributes][last_name] String
    The last name of the user
    data[attributes][name] String
    The full name of the user (first_name + last_name)
    data[attributes][email] String
    The email of the user
    data[attributes][disabled] Boolean
    When a user is disabled they cannot log into their account or create orders
    data[attributes][customer_id] Uuid
    The associated Customer

    Includes

    This request accepts the following includes:

    customer

    disabled_by

    notes
